newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Sao Paulo industrial firms sack 1,249 on Oct 7-12.
newsitem.headline: Sao Paulo industrial firms sack 1,249 on Oct 7-12.

text.p: Private industrial firms located in Sao Paulo state laid off 1,249 employees between Oct. 7 and Oct. 12, a spokeswoman for the Sao Paulo State Industries Federation (Fiesp) said.
In the previous week, Sao Paulo's industries sacked 2,376 workers.
Fourteen out of the 46 sectors included in the survey sacked personnel in the period. Seven hired new people and 25 maintained their staff unchanged, she said.
So far this year, Sao Paulo industries have laid off 154,312 workers or 7.19 percent of the Sao Paulo's industrial workforce, the spokeswoman said.
In the last 12 months, Sao Paulo firms have sacked 217,685 workers, or 9.81 percent of Sao Paulo's industrial workforce, she added.
